intro: Gardenia sagrana, commonly known as the Madagascar gardenia, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces fragrant, white to yellowish flowers. The plant is part of the Rubiaceae family and is valued for its ornamental beauty and aromatic properties. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments and prefers well-drained soil. Gardenia sagrana is often cultivated in gardens for its striking appearance and pleasant scent.
